dataitem.name: Aircraft Operational Status
dataitem.definition: Identification of the operational services available in the aircraft while airborne.

field.name: RA
field.enum: TCAS II or ACAS RA not active

field.name: TC
field.enum: no capability for Trajectory Change Reports

field.name: TS
field.enum: no capability to support Target State Reports
capable of supporting target State Reports

field.name: CDTI/A
field.definition: Cockpit Display of Traffic Information airborne

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
Additional Aircraft Status Information is available in the Reserved Expansion Field of Category 021.

dataitem.name: Data Source Identification
dataitem.definition: Identification of the ADS-B station providing information.
dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the Eurocontrol Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int/asterix/public/standard_page/sac_list.html).

dataitem.name: Service Identification
dataitem.definition: Identification of the service provided to one or more users.
dataitem.desc:
NOTE: The service identification is allocated by the system.
NOTE: The service identification is also available in item I023/015.

dataitem.name: Service Management
dataitem.definition: Identification of services offered by a ground station (identified by a SIC code).

field.name: RP
field.desc:
Report Period LSB = 0.5 s
= 0: Data driven mode
Range 0 ... 127.5 seconds, a value of 127.5 indicates 127.5 seconds or above

dataitem.desc:
NOTE:This item contains the same information as item I023/101 in ASTERIX category 023. Since not all service users receive category 023 data, this information has to be conveyed in category 021 as well.
NOTE:If this item is due to be sent according to the encoding rule above, it shall be sent with the next target report

dataitem.name: Emitter Category
dataitem.definition: Characteristics of the originating ADS-B unit.

field.name: ECAT
field.enum: highly manoeuvrable (5g acceleration capability) and high speed (>400 knotscruise)

dataitem.name: Target Report Descriptor
dataitem.definition: Type and characteristics of the data as transmitted by a system.

field.name: RC
field.enum: Range Check passed, CPR Validation pending

field.name: SAA
field.enum: Equipment capable to provide Selected Altitude
Equipment not capable to provide Selected Altitude

dataitem.desc:
NOTE: Octed 1 Bit 3 indicates that the position reported by the target is within a credible range from the ground station. The range check is followed by the CPR validation to ensure that global and local position decoding both indicate valid position information. Bit 3=1 indicates that the range check was done, but the CPR validation is not yet completed. Once CPR validation is completed, Bit 3 will be reset to 0.
NOTE: The second extension signals the reasons for which the report has been indicated as suspect (indication Confidence Level (CL) in the first extension).
NOTE: Octed 3 Bit 2 indicates that the Range Check failed, i.e. the target is reported outside the credible range for the Ground Station. For operational users such a target will be suppressed. In services used for monitoring the Ground Station, the target will be transmitted with bit 2 indicating the fault condition.
NOTE: Oected 3 Bit 5 represents the setting of the GO/NOGO-bit as defined in item I023/100 of category 023 [Ref. 3].

dataitem.name: Mode-3/A Code in Octal Representation
dataitem.definition: Mode-3/A code converted into octal representation.

dataitem.name: Time of Applicability for Position
dataitem.definition: Time of applicability of the reported position, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. The time of applicability value is reset to zero at every midnight.
2. The time of applicability indicates the exact time at which the position transmitted in the target report is valid.

dataitem.name: Time of Applicability for Velocity
dataitem.definition: Time of applicability (measurement) of the reported velocity, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. The time of applicability value is reset to zero at every midnight.
2. The time of applicability indicates the exact time at which the velocity information transmitted in the target report is valid.
3. This item will not be available in some ADS-B technologies.

dataitem.name: Time of Message Reception for Position
dataitem.definition: Time of reception of the latest position squitter in the Ground Station, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
The time of applicability value is reset to zero at every midnight.

dataitem.name: Time of Message Reception of Position–High Precision
dataitem.definition: Time at which the latest ADS-B position information was received by the ground station, expressed as fraction of the second of the UTC Time.

field.name: Time of Message Reception of Position–High Precision

dataitem.name: Time of Message Reception for Velocity
dataitem.definition: Time of reception of the latest velocity squitter in the Ground Station, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
The time of applicability value is reset to zero at every midnight.

dataitem.name: Time of Message Reception of Velocity–High Precision
dataitem.definition: Time at which the latest ADS-B velocity information was received by the ground station, expressed as fraction of the second of the UTC Time.

field.name: Time of Message Reception of Velocity–High Precision

dataitem.name: Time of ASTERIX Report Transmission
dataitem.definition: Time of the transmission of the ASTERIX category 021 report in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
The time of ASTERIX report transmission value is reset to zero at every midnight.

dataitem.name: Target Address
dataitem.definition: Target address (emitter identifier) assigned uniquely to each target.

dataitem.name: Quality Indicators
dataitem.definition: ADS-B quality indicators transmitted by a/c according to MOPS version.

field.name: NUCr or NACv
field.desc: "Navigation Uncertainty Category for velocity" NUCr or the “Navigation Accuracy Category for Velocity” NACv

field.name: NUCp or NIC
field.desc: "Navigation Uncertainty Category for Position" NUCp or “Navigation Integrity Category “NIC”.

field.name: NICBARO
field.desc: Navigation Integrity Category for Barometric Altitude"

field.name: SDA
field.desc: Horizontal Position System Design Assurance Level (as defined in version 2)

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The primary subfield is kept for backwards compatibility reasons. Version 2 NIC-values shall be mapped accordingly. This is required to ensure that downstream systems, which are not capable of interpreting extensions 2 and 3 (because they use an ASTERIX edition earlier than 2.0) still get the required information
NOTE
“Version 1” or “Version 2” refers to the MOPS version as defined in data item I021/210, bits 6/4
NOTE
Version 2” refers to the MOPS version as defined in data item I021/210, bits 6/4
NOTE
PIC=0 is defined for completeness only. In this case the third extension shall not be generated.

dataitem.name: Trajectory Intent
dataitem.definition: Reports indicating the 4D intended trajectory of the aircraft.

field.name: NAV
field.enum: Trajectory Intent Data is available for this aircraft
Trajectory Intent Data is not available for this aircraft

field.name: NVB
field.enum: Trajectory Intent Data is not valid

subfield.name: Trajectory Intent Data

field.name: Altitude
field.desc: Altitude in two’s complement form, LSB= 10ft, -1500 ft <= altitude <= 150000 ft

field.name: Latitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. -90 <= latitude <= 90 deg. LSB = 180/2^23 deg. = approx.2.145767*10^-5 deg.

field.name: Longitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. -180 <= longitude < 180 LSB = 180/2^23 deg. = approx.2.145767*10^-05 deg.

field.name: TTR
field.desc: TCP Turn radius, LSB = 0.01 Nm,0 <= TTR <= 655.35 Nm

subfield.desc:
NOTES
1. NC is set to one when the aircraft will not fly the path described by the TCP data.
2. TCP numbers start from zero.
3. LT = Lateral Type
4. VT = Vertical Type
5. TOV gives the estimated time before reaching the point. It is defined as the absolute time from midnight.
6. TOV is meaningful only if TOA is set to 1.

dataitem.name: Position in WGS-84 Co-ordinates

field.name: Latitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -90 <= latitude <= 90 deg. LSB = 180/2^23 degrees. = 2.145767 * 10^-05 degrees. This corresponds to a resolution of at least 2.4 meters

field.name: Longitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -180 <= longitude < 180 deg. LSB = 180/2^23 degrees. = 2.145767 * 10^-05 degrees. This corresponds to a resolution of at least 2.4 meters.

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
Positive longitude indicates East. Positive latitude indicates North.

dataitem.name: High-Resolution Position in WGS-84 Co-ordinates
dataitem.description: Position in WGS-84 Co-ordinates in high resolution.

field.name: Latitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -90 <= latitude <= 90 deg. LSB = 180/2^30 degrees. = 1.6764 * 10^-07 degrees. This corresponds to a resolution of at least 2 centimeters.

field.name: Longitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -180 <= longitude < 180 deg. LSB = 180/2^30 degrees = 1.6764 * 10^-07 degrees. This corresponds to a resolution of at least 2 centimeters.

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
Positive longitude indicates East. Positive latitude indicates North.

dataitem.name: Message Amplitude
dataitem.description: Amplitude, in dBm, of ADS-B messages received by the ground station, coded in two’s complement.
dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The value gives the amplitude of the latest received squitter.

dataitem.name: Geometric Height
dataitem.description: Minimum height from a plane tangent to the earth’s ellipsoid, defined by WGS-84, in two’s complement form.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. LSB is required to be less than 10 ft by ICAO.
2. A value of ‘0111111111111111’ indicates that the aircraft transmits a “greater than” indication.

dataitem.name: Flight Level
dataitem.description: Flight Level from barometric measurements, not QNH corrected, in two’s complement form.

dataitem.name: Selected Altitude
dataitem.definition: The Selected Altitude as provided by the avionics and corresponding either to the MCP/FCU Selected Altitude (the ATC cleared altitude entered by the flight crew into the avionics) or to the FMS Selected Altitude.

field.name: Altitude
field.desc: Altitude in two’s complement form LSB=25ft -1300ft <= Altitude <= 100000ft

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The Selected Altitude provided in this field is not necessarily the “Target Altitude” as defined by ICAO.
NOTE
The value of “Source” (bits 15/14) indicating “unknown” or “Aircraft Altitude” is kept for backward compatibility as these indications are not provided by “version 2” systems as defined by data item I021/210, bits 6/4.
NOTE
Vertical mode indications supporting the determination of the nature of the Selected Altitude are provided in the Reserved Expansion Field in the subfield NAV.

dataitem.name: Final State Selected Altitude
dataitem.definition: The vertical intent value that corresponds with the ATC cleared altitude, as derived from the Altitude Control Panel (MCP/FCU).

field.name: Altitude
field.desc: Altitude in in two’s complement form LSB=25ft -1300ft <= Altitude <= 100000ft

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
This item is kept for backward compatibility but shall not be used for “version 2” ADS-B systems (as defined by data item I021/210, bits 6/4) for which item 146 will be used to forward the MCP/FCU or the FMS selected altitude information. For “version 2” ADS-B systems, the vertical mode indications will be provided through the Reserved Expansion Field in the subfield NAV.

dataitem.name: Airspeed
dataitem.definition: Calculated Airspeed (Element of Air Vector).

field.name: Airspeed
field.desc: if IAS, LSB = 2-14 NM/s,if Mach, LSB = 0.001

dataitem.name: True Airspeed
dataitem.definition: True Airspeed
dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The RE-Bit, if set, indicates that the value to be transmitted is beyond the range defined for this specific data item and the applied technology. In this case the True Airspeed contains the maximum value that can be downloaded from the aircraft avionics and the RE- bit indicates that the actual value is greater than the value contained in the field.

dataitem.name: Magnetic Heading
dataitem.definition: Magnetic Heading (Element of Air Vector).
dataitem.desc:
NOTE
True North Heading is defined in the Reserved Expansion Field in the subfield TNH.

dataitem.name: Barometric Vertical Rate
dataitem.definition: Barometric Vertical Rate, in two’s complement form.
dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The RE-Bit, if set, indicates that the value to be transmitted is beyond the range defined for this specific data item and the applied technology. In this case the Barometric Vertical Rate contains the maximum value that can be downloaded from the aircraft avionics and the RE-bit indicates that the actual value is greater than the value contained in the field.

dataitem.name: Geometric Vertical Rate
dataitem.definition: Geometric Vertical Rate, in two’s complement form, with reference to WGS-84.
dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The RE-Bit, if set, indicates that the value to be transmitted is beyond the range defined for this specific data item and the applied technology. In this case the Geometric Vertical Rate contains the maximum value that can be downloaded from the aircraft avionics and the RE-bit indicates that the actual value is greater than the value contained in the field.

dataitem.name: Airborne Ground Vector
dataitem.definition: Ground Speed and Track Angle elements of Airborne Ground Vector.

field.name: Ground Speed
field.desc: Ground Speed referenced to WGS-84. (LSB) = 2-14 NM/s ≅ 0.22 kt. 0 ≤ Ground Speed < 2 NM/s

field.name: Track Angle
field.desc: Track Angle clockwise reference to “True North”. (LSB) = 360° / 2^16 (approx. 0.0055°)

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The RE-Bit, if set, indicates that the value to be transmitted is beyond the range defined for this specific data item and the applied technology. In this case the Ground Speed contains the maximum value that can be downloaded from the aircraft avionics and the RE- bit indicates that the actual value is greater than the value contained in the field.
NOTE
The Surface Ground Vector format is defined in the Reserved Expansion Field in the subfield SGV.

dataitem.name: Track Number
dataitem.definition: An integer value representing a unique reference to a track record within a particular track file.

dataitem.name: Track Angle Rate
dataitem.definition: Rate of Turn, in two’s complement form.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. A positive value represents a right turn, whereas a negative value represents a left turn.
2. “Maximum value” means Maximum value or above.
3. This item will not be transmitted for the technology “1090 MHz Extended Squitter”.

dataitem.name: Target Identification
dataitem.definition: Target (aircraft or vehicle) identification in 8 characters, as reported by the target.

field.desc: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 bits each) defining target identification when flight plan is available or the registration marking when no flight plan is available.

dataitem.name: Target Status
dataitem.definition: Status of the target

field.name: SS
field.enum: Temporary Alert (change in Mode 3/A Code other than emergency)

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
Bit-8 (ICF), when set to “1” indicates that new information is available in the Mode S GICB registers 40, 41 or 42.

dataitem.name: MOPS Version
dataitem.definition: Identification of the MOPS version used by a/c to supply ADS-B information.

field.name: VNS
field.enum: The MOPS Version is supported by the GS
The MOPS Version is not supported by the GS

field.name: VN
field.desc: Version Number. Version Number This sub-field shall contain a value describing the MOPS used by each aircraft. Currently defined for 1090 ES (LTT=2): The versions of other link technologies are assumed to be in line with the 1090 ES MOPS versions and the corresponding MASPS versions.

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
Bit 7 (VNS) when set to 1 indicates that the aircraft transmits a MOPS Version indication that is not supported by the Ground Station. However, since MOPS versions are supposed to be backwards compatible, the GS has attempted to interpret the message and achieved a credible result. The fact that the MOPS version received is not supported by the GS is submitted as additional information to subsequent processing systems.

dataitem.name: Met Information
dataitem.definition: Compound data item consisting of a one byte primary sub-field, followed by up to four fixed length data fields.

field.name: Temperature
field.desc: Temperature in degrees celsius, in two’s complement form (LSB) = 0.25 °C -100 ° <= Temperature <= 100 °C

dataitem.name: Roll Angle
dataitem.description: The roll angle, in two’s complement form, of an aircraft executing a turn.
dataitem.desc:
NOTE
Negative Value indicates “Left Wing Down”.
NOTE
Resolution provided by the technology “1090 MHz Extended Squitter” is 1 degree.

dataitem.name: Mode S MB Data
dataitem.definition: Mode S Comm B data as extracted from the aircraft transponder.

field.name: MB Data
field.desc: 56-bit message conveying Mode S Comm B message data

field.name: BDS1
field.desc: Comm B Data Buffer Store 1 Address

field.name: BDS2
field.desc: Comm B Data Buffer Store 2 Address

dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. For the transmission of BDS20, item 170 should be used.
2. For the transmission of BDS30, item 260 is used.

dataitem.name: ACAS Resolution Advisory Report
dataitem.definition: Currently active Resolution Advisory (RA), if any, generated by the ACAS associated with the transponder transmitting the RA message and threat identity data.
dataitem.desc:
NOTE
Version denotes the MOPS version as defined in I021/210, bits 6/4
NOTE
This data items copies the value of BDS register 6,2 for messageype 28, subtype 2
NOTE
The “TYP” and “STYP” items are implementation (i.e. link technology) dependent.
NOTE
Refer to ICAO Annex 10 SARPs for detailed explanations [Ref. 10].

dataitem.name: Surface Capabilities and Characteristics
dataitem.definition: Operational capabilities of the aircraft while on the ground.

field.name: POA
field.enum: Position transmitted is not ADS-B position reference point
Position transmitted is the ADS-B position reference point

field.name: CDTI/S
field.desc: Cockpit Display of Traffic Information Surface

field.name: B2 low
field.desc: Class B2 transmit power less than 70 Watts

field.name: L+W
field.desc: Length and width of the aircraft

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
Version 2 (as defined in I021/210, bits 6/4) data technology protocols encode “No Data or Unknown” with value 0. In this case data item I021/271, first extension is not generated.

dataitem.name: Data Ages
dataitem.definition: Ages of the data provided.

field.name: AOS
field.desc: Age of the latest received information transmitted in item I021/008. (LSB) = 0.1 s Maximum value =25.5 s

field.name: TRD
field.desc: Age of the last update of the Target Report Descriptor, item I021/040. (LSB) = 0.1 s Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: M3A
field.desc: Age of the last update of the Mode 3/A Code, item I021/070. (LSB) = 0.1 s Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: QI
field.desc: Age of the latest information received to update the Quality Indicators, item I021/090. (LSB) = 0.1 s Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: TI
field.desc: Age of the last update of the Trajectory Intent information updating item I021/110. (LSB) = 0.1 s Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: MAM
field.desc: Age of the latest measurement of the message amplitude, item I021/132. (LSB) = 0.1 s Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: GH
field.desc: Age of the information contained in item 021/140. (LSB) = 0.1 s Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: FL
field.desc: Age of the Flight Level information in item I021/145. (LSB) = 0.1 s Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: ISA
field.desc: Age of the Intermediate State Selected Altitude in item I021/146. (LSB) = 0.1 s. Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: FSA
field.desc: Age of the Final State Selected Altitude in item I021/148. (LSB) = 0.1 s Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: AS
field.desc: Age of the Airspeed contained in item I021/150. (LSB) = 0.1 s Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: TAS
field.desc: Age of the value for the True Airspeed in item I021/151. (LSB) = 0.1 s Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: MH
field.desc: Age of the value for the Magnetic Heading in item I021/152. (LSB) = 0.1 s Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: BVR
field.desc: Age of the Barometric Vertical Rate contained in I021/155. (LSB) = 0.1 s. Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: BVR
field.desc: Age of the Geometric Vertical Rate in item I021/157. (LSB) = 0.1 s. Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: GV
field.desc: Age of the Ground Vector in item I021/160. (LSB) = 0.1 s. Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: TAR
field.desc: Age of item I021/165 Track Angle Rate. (LSB) = 0.1 s. Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: TI
field.desc: Age of the Target Identification in item I021/170. (LSB) = 0.1 s. Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: TS
field.desc: Age of the Target Status as contained in item I021/200. (LSB) = 0.1 s. Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: MET
field.desc: Age of the Meteorological data contained in I021/220. (LSB) = 0.1 s. Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: ROA
field.desc: Age of the Roll Angle value as in item I021/230. (LSB) = 0.1 s. Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: ARA
field.desc: Age of the latest update of an active ACAS Resolution Advisory. (LSB) = 0.1 s Maximum value = 25.5 s

field.name: SCC
field.desc: Age of the latest information received on the surface capabilities and characteristics of the respective target. (LSB) = 0.1 s. Maximum value = 25.5 s

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
In all the subfields, the age is the time delay since the latest update received from the target.
NOTE
In all the subfields, the maximum value indicates “maximum value or above”.

dataitem.name: Receiver ID
dataitem.definition: Designator of Ground Station in Distributed System.
